character: Transcribed by Joan the English Chick (<a href="mailto

dialogue:
• I do not own the characters or situations of BTVS, and I claim no credit for the content of this episode. I have merely transcribed what appeared on my screen, with help from the closed captions.
  • I prefer that you link to this transcript on the Psyche site rather than post it on your site, but you can post it on your site if you want, as long as you keep my name and email address on it. Please also keep my disclaimers intact.
  • You can use my transcripts in your fanfiction stories; you don't have to ask my permission. (However, if you use large portions of episode dialogue in your fanfic, I recommend you give credit to the person who wrote the episode.)
  • I apologize in advance for my lame transcription of the fight scenes. I don't know the names of different punches and kicks. Use your imagination.
Why can't you people just leave me alone?
Into each generation a Slayer is born.
You're the Slayer, and we're like the Slayerettes.
The three of us have been together from the beginning. We've always gone on patrols, and, uh, done demon research with her and everything.
We're talking about two very powerful witches (shot of Willow and Tara doing a spell) and a thousand-year-old ex-demon (shot of Anya)
That chip was deeply imbedded in your cerebral cortex.
I can't bite anything. I can't even hit people.
Spike had a little trip to the vet, and now he doesn't chase the other puppies any more.
I know you'll never love me. I know that I'm a monster, but you treat me like a man.
They had to be certain the Slayer would protect it with her life, so they sent the key to her in the form of a sister.
You were created to open the gates that separate dimensions.
Destroy it, and the will of the beast will be broken.
You have to take care of each other. You have to be strong. Be brave. Live.
Thank god. (Tara looks confused) No, I mean, my store hasn't been looted.
Then where are they? Why aren't they here?
(getting agitated) They could be hurt. Xander could be lying somewhere broken and bleeding, calling out my name.
Like that, oh god! (walks on) What if, what if they're really hurt, what if they're dead?
Because he's with Willow. And if something ... happened, I'd know. (softly) And so would you.
I'm sure of it. (hugs her) They're fine.
(trying to convince herself) They're both fine.
Maybe they got lost, in the woods.
The woods? Are we going back to the woods? I hate the woods. All those woodsy trees.
(excited) No, it's okay. Lost is good. Willow and I always know how to find each other!
Ssh! (eyes closed) Aradia, hear my words.
Okay, this is really starting to grate my cheese. These woods aren't that big. Now, I know we've been going straight because I've been following the North Star.
(looks up) Xander. (they stop) That's not the North Star. It's an airplane.
Nah, that's not an airplane, it's definitely ... (looks harder) ...a blimp! (embarrassed) But I can see how one ... could make that airplane mistake.
(panting) I, I can't walk any more. I need to rest.
You said that an hour ago. I just ... that spell took a lot out of me.
As for example, snakes? How come you didn't tell us how much-
What were we into back there, Will?
Do not get all avoidy on me.
I'm not avoidy, I just ... we have bigger problems. Demons?
Demons! Ah. There's something you don't see every day. (sarcastic chuckle) Unless you're us.
(annoyed) Yeah, and now we're lost, so can we - (sees something ahead) What's that?
"Hello"? We're being hunted, and you're hello-ing a strange fast-moving light in the dark? It could be anything.
Stay behind me. (picks up a stick from the ground, moves forward)
Stay down. I'll take care of this.
A bug! A big fiery bug! (trying to shoo it away)
Get off! Do fireflies bite? No, they probably burn, don't they? They - yaa!
(smiling) Xander, it's not a bug. (as it flies around her face) It's Tara.
And how long have you known that your girlfriend's Tinkerbell?
Do you hear me? (walks onto the porch) I said get off my property!
Leave us alone. (yells) Get outta here!
I-it looks like they're just ... wrecking stuff. No thought other than just destruct-o-rama.

Uh, oh, nothing, just, uh ... (nods toward the action) looked like fun. (Dawn gives him a look) I'm just sayin'. Yeah, it's just ... (looks around) with this kind of frolicking going on all around town, we're not gonna get very far without...
(calls) Already been looted, sorry! Uh, try the appliance store down the block, they've got great toasters.
I knew you weren't dead. (hugs him)
Wow, then why was I so worried?
(leading Willow to a chair) Are you-
Uh, not yet. But, but I will be.
We've been calling the house, but-
Maybe they're on their way here. I mean, this place is NORAD, and we are at DefCon One.
Okay, I so need male friends.
We have to go out and look for them. (tries to get up but Tara pushes her back down)
There's this guy at work I kind of hit it off with. Tito. I mean, he seems like a good...
(embarrassed) You were talking about Dawn and Spike, of course.
Um, question. (to Willow) You want us to go back out there?
Well, yeah. Uh, unless somebody's got a better idea.
Well, um, it's just ... we're minus a Buffybot. And, uh, Spike is missing in action somewhere with Dawn, and Giles flew away, and, uh, well you, you're looking a little magicked-out.
Ahn honey, we're nearing your point, right?

It's just, how are we supposed to fight these guys? (Everyone looks at her) I mean, we can take a vampire or two, sure, but there's a whole cavalcade of demons out there ... (uncertainly) I mean, I think this, you know ... it, it takes, um ... I mean, I ... we need...
So ... we're it, gang. (gets painfully to her feet) Xander, grab the weapons. We're gonna look for Dawn and Spike.
If we're gonna go, we should go now, they're just getting more and more worked up by the moment.
Well, they can't keep it up forever. I mean, maybe they'll party themselves out, you know, tire of this place and move on.
Say hello to your new home, boys.
This here is a momentous occasion, the beginning of a new era.
Now, no question, the open backroads and highways have been good to us. But we've got ourselves a juicy little burg here, just ripe for the picking. And I ain't in no hurry to leave it, you?
So I figure, what better way to kick off our ... semi-settling-down, than with a little christening?
A symbolic act commemorating the new order around here ... and ridding ourselves of any not-so-pleasant reminders of the old.
All in one quick, really, *really* violent fell swoop.
(holds up the gun) Gentlemen, start your engines.
(looking at Buffy) Another one for the fire, boys.
It wasn't your fault. We, we don't know if the spell would have worked, even if the demons hadn't-

Maybe it wasn't supposed to. I mean, those demons showing up at the exact wrong time? Maybe we really were in over our heads. Invoking forces that we have no right to. Maybe the fates sent down all that destruction on us to stop us. I mean...
You mean, maybe it was my fault.
(softly to Xander) I'm not saying we announce it this second.
Well, I think it would please them to know we're engaged. And I think Willow in particular could use a real morale-booster right now.
Can we talk about this later?
Well, but it's just all the excuses for not telling everyone we're engaged are gone now. I mean, aside from hell bikers, there's nothing standing in our way. This is it. No more surprises.
Ah, peachy. No doubt to lead the wild bunch right to us again. Hey Will, next time this thing's damaged, couldn't ya program it to find the nearest Radio Shack, or...
Buffy? (moves toward her) Buffy, are you...
It's Willow. Can you hear me?
Nothing! She - she's ... she's in shock.
Her hands are bleeding. Her fingers.
No. How could we ... so stupid!
Our spell. Our resurrection spell worked like a magic charm. We brought you back to life, Buffy. (looks at Willow) Right where we left her.
She had to ... dig out of her own grave.
You aren't reaching her, she's too traumatized.
Hey, Buffy. Uh, here's some good news that might perk you right up. Uh, Xander and I have an announcement.
Buffy .... it's gonna be all right. We brought you back. You're home now.
(muffled) Not looking too good, though, is she?
(muffled) I don't see you winning too many beauty contests.
...unless the Miss "My Face Fell Off" pageant gets going.
The better to cut you down to size, grandma.
Ah. So you got a witch in the mix.
I happen to be a very powerful man-witch myself. (Razor looks amused) Or ... male... (over his shoulder to Willow) Is it a warlock?

Plus, we have a Slayer here, uh, who might actually be looking to eat some brains, so, I think a little quiet moseying, no hard feelings, and I'm sure your demon horde won't think any the less of you.
(shakes head) Now, my boys, see, that's tricky. They came looking for a massacre...
(Buffy's POV, muffled) ...and I think you got exactly enough magic between you for a kiddie birthday party.
Whoa. Well, I better back off, or you might, what? Pull a rabbit out of a hat?
(horrified) Don't, don't do that! (to Tara) Why would she do that? (Tara shakes her head)
We don't want trouble ... you don't want trouble.
Of course we want trouble, we're demons. We're really all about trouble.
Now let me tell you something, children. We're not gonna fight you. We're just gonna hold you down and enjoy ourselves for a few hours.
(OS) You might even live through it. (Buffy walks forward) Except that certain of my boys got some...
...anatomical incompatibilities that, uh, tend to tear up little girls. (grins) So, who wants to go first?
I was really hoping it'd be you.
(looks around in confusion) Where did I go?
Where did I go? I was here. Here. But then I ran away.
No. Not me. The other Buffy.
I don't ... I don't ... know where she ran off to. Maybe-
Tsk. Look what those filthy buggers done to you. (loudly, to Dawn) Willow's slap-and-paste job's not gonna do the trick this time. Robot's done.
Hey. (looks all around, alarmed) Little bit? (yells) Dawn!
She's Buffy. She's herself again. (She looks at him) You're back, Buffy, you really are.
She just ... needs some time is all.
(OS) The important thing is that she's back. She'll be fine.
Now what kind of Slayer is it runs out on her buddies just when they need her the most?
So, witch, got a little power after all. Well, let's see what tricks you can manage while I choke the life outta-
Shot of the tower from afar.
Is it you? I mean really?
Don't jump, Buffy, don't move! Just walk to me. Please!
I'm your sister. Dawn. We were up here ... together, and then ... you went away. And you don't wanna do that again. I don't know how you're back, but you are, and please, just stay still.
Or-or move. But-but towards me. Because the tower was built by crazy people and I don't think it's holding up very well.
No! Buffy, no! (taking a tiny step closer) You're here ... with me. (another tiny step) Whatever happened to you, whatever you've been through, it's ... it's over now. You're-
We have to get off this tower!
(quietly) It was so ... clear ... on this spot. I remember ... how ... shiny ... and clear everything was. (shakes her head) But ... now ... now...
You told me I had to be strong ... and I've tried. (tearful) But it's been so hard without you.
I'm sorry. I promise I'll do better, I will! (still tearful) If you're with me. Stay with me ... please. I need you to live. Live! For-
Buffy. You ... you ... (touches Buffy's cheek) ...you're really here.
(crying) You're alive, and you're home. You're home.
Joss Whedon and Marti Noxon.THE END[an error occurred while processing this directive]
